Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Catherine B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, easy to get to all areas, but not too noisy. Triple room coped well with 3 teenage boys! Staff helpful whenever asked. Didn't get breakfast there but lots of cafes/bakeries locally . Would stay here again if I visit Barcelona again, hotel does as the label says! Clean, comfortable, perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: va g Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very nice, clean a very good located, we love the breakfast menu very complete, the people working in there very friendly. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Location”
Reviews.Author: noonoosdad
Reviews.Content: Having read some reviews before staying at this Hotel, I was a bit unsure exactly what we would find when we arrived. To be fair, the Hotel is well located being a 5 minute walk to either La Ramblas and Pl Catalunya where the excellent Aero Bus Service runs to and from the Airport. My family and I arrived at the Hotel approximately 2pm in the afternoon and met at the entrance by one of the male Receptionists who almost tried to send us away as our Rooms would not be ready but then quickly interrupted by another receptionist who seemed more accomodating and allocated a room on the third floor situated at the rear overlooking what I can only describe as a 'quaint' looking appartment block. The room was meant to sleep three with two single beds and one Camp Bed affair folded down from inside a cupboard so that the sleeper's head was in an alcove and not terribly comfortable, did had an LG Flat Screen TV on the wall and AC. We were a bit annoyed to find that the Maids didn't clean the Room till after 4pm each day which was a nuisance if one wished to retire for a Siesta before Dinner. We found noise levels with slamming of doors, noisy plumbing and Guests a little disturbing at times. The Hotel boasts a rooftop Swimming Pool and Sunbathing area. I would describe this as just a small Pool, far too shallow or big enough to swim in but the Sunbathing Terrace was pleasant with a number of Sunbeds, Vending machine and a W.C. The Breakfast Room/Caffeteria was a large a pleasant room on the first floor with a good variety of Hot and Cold etc. On the whole, the staff were pleasant enough except for perhaps our experience of one Receptionist on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, but surly staff”
Reviews.Author: connieblue16
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a group of friends and had a bit of a complicated booking due to me checking in and out at different times but staying with my friends in the same room. The same person was at the front desk when it wa explained on 3 different occasions but this guy couldn't find the booking each time and kept saying we were wrong and there was no booking. He was very unfriendly the whole way through. My friends also met some breakfast staff who could do with communication lessons too. However not all the employees were unhelpful. Was a bit hit and miss. Rooms were reasonable. I was surprised to find they weren't real spring mattresses, but foam. Was fairly comfortable. Hair dryer was one attached to the wall and not powerful enough. One thing the hotel has for it is its amazing location. Just off the square, and metro and tourist bus stops across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Reception Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kate W
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this hotel for it's convenience to Las Ramblas, Metro, Trains, Shops and Aerobus stops. Just back from a second stay there and was extremely disappointed with the Reception Staff whom I found to be very unhelpful and unfriendly which is a shame for such a good value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reception Staff”
Reviews.Author: Donatellla
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for price. Second time there. Just back and have to say how UNHELPFUL and UNFRIENDLY RECEPTION Staff were - what a pity they are letting their other working colleagues and the hotel down. Sheila from Ireland

Reviews.Title: “no better place to stay”
Reviews.Author: julie_j88
Reviews.Content: gorgeous room, excellent location, great value for money - what else do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scott1sh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here Fri-Sun for a weekend break in Barcelona. The location of this hotel is excellent. Its minutes from Las Ramblas but what we found even handier was that it was minutes from Placa Cataluyna where the Aerobus drops you from the airport. (You get the bus back tot he airport from here too). So super easy and quick when you only have a short stay in the city. The hotel itself was nice, good breakfast buffet included and the rooms were what you would expect. My only slight negative was that the window in our room looked into an internal lift shaft area, but we werent there to spend loads of time in our room. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Tours of Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: Hp1983
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beyond belief. Upon our arrival we checked in and the receptionist hardly raised his head to look at us. We were shown to our room and after about 5 seconds in the room an incredible drilling noise ran through the hotel and shook the walls. We were asked if we planned to sleep while we were there. We said of course and were shown to a different room on the 5th floor. The doorway of this room must have been some sort of time travelling device as we were transported back to the 60s. I went to reception to complain and was told we could have the quiet, old, horrible room or the nice room with an infernal racquet. Thankfully we had booked through a travel agent and he managed to get us a nice room in a quiet area of the hotel. Well it was quiet until we were awoken by what sounded like an orgy happening outside our room door. It was very disturbing to say the least and can't understand how this happened when there are cameras around the hotel. I rang reception to tell them about what was happening and they were very slow to send someone up. Do not ever stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “september family break”
Reviews.Author: ren0val
Reviews.Content: very convieniant, close to the rambles small rooftop pool a blessing in september helpfull staff lovely bedrooms would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to visit all the sites of Barcelona, you won't get more central than this; shops metro aerobus and buses all ne”
Reviews.Author: Andrealing
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through BA the whole trip cost 500 quid for 3 nights incuding breakfast and return flights from Heathrow for 2 people. Really good value considering its half term! The hotel is situated near plaza universitat where we got off the aerobus which cost 10.30 euros and took half an hour from barcelona airport. The room we were allocated was room 312 at the rear of the hotel very quiet and a good size. Two sink spacious bathroom, towels changed, room tidied and bed made everyday. Large flat screen TV, fridge and small but useful lounge area to prepare coffee and relax in private. Only one problem no kettle but we did bring our own. The breakfast is buffet style; the range of food was incredible scrambled eggs, bacon fried potatoes cheeses cold meats etc etc. Staff were really friendly and helpful they even looked after our bags when we arrived early before our room was ready.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: high0nlife
Reviews.Content: We had made reservations at the Hotel Lleo' for two weekends in Barcelona. Upon arrival we were met by a very courteous staff. They were more than accomodating and their recommondations for dining, getting around Barcelona and points of interest were more than helpful. The lobby was very clean as were their rooms. We left Barcelona for a week and the hotel held or luggage - no charge -- for us so that we did not have to carry excess baggage with us. The hotel is located within walking distance to transportation, shopping and dining. A perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: 1horselover
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lleo was clean and comfortable, with a great location. Just a short walk from Plaza Catalunya and Las Rambla, without all of the noise. However, the front desk service was very poor. Seems like the front desk folks were more interested in taking a smoking break just outside the front door instead of being at their post to answer the phone or help in other ways. If you can put up with that sort of frustration, I would say this would be a good bargain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean steady miod range hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neil2509
Reviews.Content: We got exactly what we wanted This was a decent 3* centrally located hotel near Place de Catalunya. Excellent location close to La Ramblas and metro station. We went with 3 generations of family and all enjoyed it. The rooms were basic but clean and satisfactory. Bathroom fine, beds comfortable and quiet. The breakfast was good with a decent choice of cereal, pastries fruit and hot food for all tastes. The staff were poleasant and helpful throughout. All in all I would recommend this as a budget hotel. It would have cost 50% more for us to stay at a 4* hotle close by and given that you really only sleep and eat breakfast in the hotel we chose to spend money on other things including a memorable trip to the Cpmp Nou - aweasome

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a bit shabby”
Reviews.Author: elleelleEssonne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located, clean and has comfortable beds. The shower was powerful but because of the structure of the shower panel, water went all over the floor (and I mean all over) however careful we were. Our room needed decorating as did the bathroom, where the paint was peeling (due to the over active shower). The walls were very thin - you could hear the person snoring next door and once the TV went on you could hear that too. The TV worked but not if the hairdryer was on at the same time. I've seen other reviews where the staff members were criticised. This was not our experience. They were helpful and professional but not obsequious.

Reviews.Title: “Sleaze rooms/hotel in a very attractive part of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: 1060Wien
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice (why?): both times old, small, run down rooms (one time even without a window)! Breakfast: disappointing Service: not too friendly The only plus: the hotel is really in a top spot of Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Lois365
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the service we received, reception staff were efficent and polite, not over friendly but who cares as long as they do their jobs well.Being allowed to leave your luggage free of charge before and after check in and out was especially helpful. Our rear facing room was a little dated, but the adjustable electronic beds were extremely comfortable and clean. The hairdrier in the bathroom was surprisingly powerful. We thought the breakfast was excellent, with a good selection, and we also had a nice reasonably priced lunch in the snack bar. Despite a small hiccup with our room safe, we had an enjoyable stay, and would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: GailManning
Reviews.Content: Great location right at the top of the ramblas Very clean Nice staff Didn't eat there so can't comment but would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Corina82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not really special, but it is certainly ok when you look for a decent place to stay for a citybreak. The rooms are a bit dated, but clean (which is offcourse the most important). The bed was also ok. The shower is in a bath, but was good heated and with enough water and there's a hairdryer. In the room you find a little fridge wich you may use for cooling your own drinks. We had a room near the elevator, it didn't bother us, but it was little noisy with the liftnoises and people talking, so when you need a quiet night, try not to take a room near the elevator. Our room had a window, but it looked on a wall, so hardly no daylight. I think the rooms with balcony are a bit more pleasant to enjoy the cityvibes! We could use our room earlier, and on the last day we could leave our luggage in a secured area without any charge. The breakfastbuffet is ok. The pool on the roof looks nice, and is a nice place to relax! The looking is very good, just around the corner of La Rambla, and lot of places within walking distance (shopping, Casa Battlo, Palau Guell, the old area etc) and also for public transport the hotel is good located. The staff is correct but not really in for a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: happytravels87_11
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. We booked our room based on the nice pictures on the web and when we arrived we were thrilled with the nice modern room we were given. However we soon realised there was no bathroom door, and when we went back to tell them they said 'yes, it broke off'. Apparently it's acceptable for a 3 star hotel to offer a room with no bathroom door. They then offered us another room, which was a complete dive in the back of the hotel which obviously hadn't had the reservations. It was a completely different room....dark and dingy with a mouldy bathroom and the toilet facing a wall about 20cm away. We also ran out of toilet paper and were told that we couldn't have anymore until morning. Reception ended up handing us 6 napkins and told us to come back in the morning. Good location but poor rooms and very poor service!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice pool, clean, but still kind of dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: TomasMPrague
Reviews.Content: We booked dexluxe room based on picture (balcony, lots of space, full of light, jacuzzi,.. ) on hotel pages and were ensured by email from hotel that we will get this room. Upon our arrival, we got room with no balcony, small, and no jacuzzi - just shower (room itself was very modern and nice, shower as well - but we expected balcony and jacuzzi). There was also some of noise from corridor. After we claimed, we've been given (with some problems) another room - yes, it had a jacuzzi, electric bed, and tiny balcony (i do not know what they call a balcony in Spain - i understand a place where can you put table and relax chairs, not just a space 50x100cm placed into noisy street). So formally room had properties of deluxe room, but was little bit old fashioned, and definitely was not room from picture and therefor did not meet our expectations. Breakfast was fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but breakfast a bit basic!”
Reviews.Author: cjc247
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and beds comfortable. Great location, only 5 minutes walk from Las Ramblas and Catalunya Square. Starbucks, Subway and various shops in the same street. Breakfast wasn't great - very limited choice and the restaurant menu only consisted of fast food. Don't ask hotel to book a taxi to airport, especially on a Sunday as they totally rip you off - we paid twice as much on the return journey as we did into Barcelona. Would rather stay at Hotel Jazz across the road, unfortunately the prices were much higher than last year.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: JasonBirmingham
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just around the corner from the main strip la ramblas which leads to the beach.The rooms are very clean and spacious.We only had room only so only had contact with with the reception staff,who were helpful but could of smiled,only fault.I must say if you go out to eat don't eat on the main strip,it is very expensive,you can find lovely places to eat down the back streets.You must do one of the bus tours around barcelona where you will visit the Sagrada Familia,its a church which looks gothic from the one side,they have been building it for over 100 years and is due for completeion in 2026,AMAZING.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: soba1979
Reviews.Content: The location is very good since you're close to the Ramblas and to placa de catalunya. The room we got was quite small and was poorly lit. The breakfast is not worth the money, especially since you have a huge amount of places to go to in the neighborhood. Last but not least, the staff was not friendly. I can't even remember being greeted. It was my first time in Barcelona so I can't compare this hotel to others, but price-quality wise I know I can find better deals in Paris, Rome and Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - average hotel”
Reviews.Author: GabbyNZ
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lleo is in a perfect location close to the metro and a short walk away from the main shops and restaurants. Our bedroom had a tiny balcony looking down the street but we were not disturbed by noise from traffic, comfortable beds and good sleeps. Bathroom and over all cleanliness was ok but not great. Pool area was nice to have although a bit small. Breakfast was average, large selection but nothing fantastic - were surprised they had canned fruit when there was a fresh fruit and vege market just down the road! Check in staff were not overly friendly, do not recall even getting a greeting, the bell boy was more helpful. All in all an ok stay, would we go back? Only if we couldnt find anything else better in the same location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool, but a chain hotel feel.”
Reviews.Author: lovessunandbeach
Reviews.Content: Our last few days in Barcelona we stayed in Hotel Lleo, mainly for the rooftop pool which was refreshing and relaxing. We had an uncomfortable sleep the first night and upon investigation the next day realized the mattresses were futon mattresses on a flexible slat frame. Hence the bad nights of sleep! We felt like we were sleeping in a hammock. For a nice hotel in the city I do believe they should invest in a proper mattress and bed frame. They did offer another room however it had the same situation. Our second shift reception worker was super friendly and was able to get us a picnic lunch for our early light the day we left. Overall the room itself looked nice, but the bathroom was a bit dingy looking and outdated. Our stay was pleasant, but not restful. Close location to all the action of the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, recommended”
Reviews.Author: Missus_London
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights with a group of girlfriends. Having read some disappointing reviews on Trip Advisor, the hotel actually exceeded my expectations. The standard rooms were more than adequate - but then we were all single occupancy, so might be more of a squeeze for couples. Some rooms have been refurbished (1st floor) and look much, much nicer than the older rooms. I echo all the positives already mentioned in previous reviews - location is ideal, breakfasts are super, very good value for money hotel and has the benefit of a roof-top pool to unwind beside. The only areas for improvement are: - insufficient sunbeds beside the pool... but then again, I wouldn't want it to be overcrowded, so perhaps not. (It was just frustrating to arrive at the pool at the end of both days, to find that all the sunbeds - no more than a dozen - were already occupied.) - empty minibar in the room. Would have been nice to at least have had the option of water in there. - Bizarre shower screen which was too big for the bath, so you had to do some interesting manoeuvering to stand in the bath and fold out the screen. Would be impossible for a large person! The shower-massage-jets also seemed like a good idea, but in practice were disappointingly ineffective. - Although the rooms come with a safe, there was no information to advise that you have to ask Reception for a special 'toggle' to insert into the back of the safe door and pay 10euro deposit, plus 2euros (I think) per day. - No tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. Despite these minor points, I wouldn't hesitate returning to the Hotel LLeo for future visits to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “good location, clean, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: speedy1959
Reviews.Content: very good location close to Catalunia sq. 5 min to metro and la Ramblas after day of traveling, very pleasant to find small pool on the roof. the rooms are small & clean, try to have a room not to the back side.

Reviews.Title: “location perfect average hotel”
Reviews.Author: cathIreland
Reviews.Content: stayed here for one night after our cruise, location was great,rooms very large,the pool looked great but had only a few loungers so we could not stay, breakfast was ok,very near the airport bus stop, had no problems with this hotel but did not have the wow factor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, large rooms”
Reviews.Author: moll068
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights prior to cruise. Checked in late - 10pm - with no fuss. Had booked triple and double rooms. Very spacious, clean rooms. Double room looked out onto main street but still quiet. 2 min walk to Las ramblas. Breakfast was adequate. Roof top pool small but nice. Overall great location, reasonable rate with large rooms. Staff were all very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but the staff!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: VeteranMonkey
Reviews.Content: My self and 8 other friends stayed here for a weekend break. The Location is fairly good about a 20 min walk from the sea and 5 mins to the main stretch of shops and bars etc. BUT and there seems to be always a but however the staff are shocking unhelpful didnt speak not even on check in just totally rude!!! and for this reason I would not stay again they want tobe grateful they have a job and hotel with customer skills like these

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel for a short break in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: manchestericarus
Reviews.Content: The Lleo hotel is in Barcelona City Centre, just off the main square, Plaza Catalunya. This is the transport hub for buses and Metro (Underground). Access to anywhere in the city is simple from here. The hotel is 5 minutes stroll ( with a suitcase) from the Airport 'bus drop-off point, and about 200 metres from the top end of Las Ramblas, the main tourist street in the city. The hotel is spotlessly clean, the staff are friendly and helpful. Bedrooms are a reasonable size, and have a small balcony overlooking a busy main road. However, traffic noise is not a problem when the door is closed. Breakfast is the usual continental fare; fruit, youghhurt, cereals, croissants, cheese and meats, toast, bacon sausage, scrambled egg. Quite adequate to set you up for the day. We arrived at 11am and were given our room immediately, although check-in is not until 2.00.pm. On check-out day, our luggage was stored until we were ready to leave for the airport. If I visit Barcelona again, I will stay at The Lleo.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location, but as with all big cities, watch out for pickpockets... even in the hotel lobby”
Reviews.Author: Ttaylo3
Reviews.Content: First visit to Barcelona, and I must say that this property is great. Located right down two, a two minute stroll to the main drag. The rooms were well appointed, with very nice beds, and large bathrooms. Everything was clean and organized. Staff was friendly and helpful, but didn't go out of their way... for example, didn't acknowledge you when you entered the hotel. While checking in, two pickpockets followed us into the hotel, but thankfully, we saw what they were up to. When we informed the hotel about the incident, they described the individuals, and we had the impression that they had dealt with them before.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, dust in the room”
Reviews.Author: MagmanSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: Have been about 10 times in Barcelona so I know my way around. Nice hotel in the centre of the action. Easy to get to from BCN Airport (use A1 Aerobus, stop at Universitat, hotel is 3 minutes walking distance). We stayed in a triple room for 2 nights. Room located on 1st floor, very large, furnitures a bit outdated. Flat screen and electric beds. Funny litlle terrace/solarium attached. Bathroom was OK. Little pool on rooftop. Breakfast was nice but nothing too original. Only thing was that we found big amounts of dust in corners of the room. Beds were extra clean but don't know when floors would have been cleaned. Only dark point for this middle range hotel. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short break”
Reviews.Author: chrispb
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, just minutes from the aeroport bus-stop at Universtat. Rooms are quite spacious and spotlessly clean. We had a front room with a small balcony from which you can see Placa Catalunya and there was no problem with noise. Reception staff were professional and helpful. There's also a small roof-top pool which would be useful for the hotter months, It's located in the same street as Hotel Jazz but far better value. We'd definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING.BEST HOTEL IN BARCELONA!!!!!!!!!!!!!! GREAT LOCATION .GREAT PEOPLE.GREAT ROOMS.”
Reviews.Author: daver2025
Reviews.Content: ive been 7 times to barcelona and wouldnt stay anywhere expect the hotel lleo the staff are fanstatic and extremely helpful to me and my grandad.the food is great and the breakfast choice is massive. ideally located for the las ramblas only steps away. the hotels rooms are great. i would recommend you staying here if you go to barcelona.this hotel is the best .im going back in april i cant wait. the staff rachael,tj,liberty,pablo,albert and the others are all fanstastic cant wait to return to barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: FDUANE
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lleo is in a fantastic location, right off Las Ramblas its very centrally located. You can get on the tourist hop on-hop off bus nearly right outside the hotel door!! It is a lovely, clean, comfortable hotel with an absolutely fabulous breakfast. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, very clean, convenient location, budget-priced, w/breakfast and free WiFi!”
Reviews.Author: geaux-saints-11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Lleo before and after our cruise and were very pleased with its services. Our superior room was "spotless" - very clean and spacious. Rooms at the back are quiet with no view; whereas, rooms facing the street have views w/ street noise - cars, pedestrians' chatter. The hotel was located w/in a 10-minute walk from where the airport shuttle bus dropped us and easy to find, w/in a 5-minute walk to the Ramblas and the metro. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet, 7 AM - 12 noon, with a nice selection of foods. (Unsure if no breakfast is an option; breakfast was included in our rate). Two computers were free for use in the business center and free WiFi available in all of the rooms! Although it is a "no frills" hotel, Lleo served our needs very well. The staff was pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Basic hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: tybro
Reviews.Content: Location is great. Room was outdated, but clean and adequate. Breakfast was good if it is included in room price, but way too expensive if you have to pay for it. There are plenty of places to grab breakfast within walking distance so you don't need to pay for the hotel's. Front desk staff was not at all friendly and didn't seem to like Americans, but that didn't really affect our stay. Overall, a good, clean place to stay in an awesome location for a good price. Can't ask for more than that I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, and great location”
Reviews.Author: Conherradura
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with two nephews, aged 17 and 18. It suited us perfectly. Rooms were spotless, and relatively comfortable. The location in the centre of the city was perfect, and noise was not a problem despite the pretty busy street outside. we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff and poor room”
Reviews.Author: Sloane67
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel! we had paid extra for a superior room which is suposed to have electric beds,jacuzzi bath and better fixtures.We got a standard room with no electric beds! in fact the bed had a bit of chipboard under it to support the old matress. We asked the staff on reception and they insisted that it was a superior room with electric beds and that it was a three star and not the Hilton! very rude indeed!.when I asked about the better equiped room we had paid for they said 'Ahh yes my father is good with photo shop' and laughed ,how rude and not funny.The shower attachment was broken so you could not even stand under it. Very bad attitude and rude reception staff and they could not careless about there customers ,there are better hotels than this in the same area for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “one of barcelona hidden gems”
Reviews.Author: ptr84
Reviews.Content: having booked my weekend trip to barcelona as a christmas present for my girlfriend for april, our trip had to be recheduled due to the icelandic volcano. i have to say both the airline we were travelling with and th ehotel were very helpful in assisting with our rescheduling of our trip. when we got to the hotel we were delighted to find out about the lovely roof terrace and swimming pool. the hotel is clean and we found the staff friendly. would defnatly re book if i returned to barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Curt and officious reception staff”
Reviews.Author: samantha_atkinson2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely, breakfast great. The rooms were spotless and I have to take my hat off to the maid service, rooms cleaned and tidied daily. The location was fab too. However, on arrival the reception manager was very uninterested in our arrival and wasn't helpful when I asked about Tourist Information for the travel card. Later in the week, it was Fiesta time and I took the trouble to ask about their culture and what the characters in the parade represented. The same reception manager, just shrugged and said "its fiesta time". I gave up in the end. I wouldn't let it put me off going again, the rest of it was well worth it but they don't endear themselves to tourists wishing to use their facilities. The man who checked us out was a bit better but still not friendly given the amount of money we were passing over. If they don't want to be in service, they should go get a job where they don't have to face the public. Great hotel anyway in spite of this.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and adjustable beds”
Reviews.Author: nightflight84
Reviews.Content: Great location, just back far enough to get a good nights sleep but not to far from the action, just a 2 min walk. Hotel is far from moden, lobby is grand unlike the rooms but all in all it was clean and a coomfy bed that was electrically adjustable which was a novelty for my wife!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bubbybranch
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic, very clean, comfortable bed, the room is big, had our own private court yard, a small sitting room with table and two chairs, a nice desk, the bathroom has a bath which is also a spa. They have FREE internet to wi fi - in my glory !!!!!, the TV has 40 channels. We stayed at the Novotel London Tower Bridge in London and the Mercure in Paris, both Accor hotels, but Hotel Lleo outshines them in price, facilities and quality. Staff very friendly and helpful. We had dinner at the hotel a couple of nights, food very nice and very well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel close to the ramblas”
Reviews.Author: NeilOakshott
Reviews.Content: This was a very well priced hotel with rooms of varying size...the smaller ones perhaps less 'value' but for the location and the 3 stars it was excellent. Very nice rooftop pool which though small was a very pleasant environment. Breakfast buffet was good and generally everything was clean and well maintained. Not much of a bar area but hey, you're 3 minutes from the Ramblas so this is hardly a problem. The staff were generally very pleasant and Albert in particular was very very helpful. They also recommended some good non-touristy restaurants. Very fast wi-fi as well!!!!! Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, great stay”
Reviews.Author: nikkiz730
Reviews.Content: We arrived into Barcelona from a 10 hour plane ride and immediately found our hotel. It was a 7 minute walk from where the airport shuttle drops you off. It was also one block from La Ramble. It was a large sign and easy to find. The person at the front desk was helpful and we were able to get into our room about an hour early. We requested a room for two but were actually given a room with three single beds! This allowed for more room. This hotel bathroom was one of the biggest we had in Europe. The front desk gave us a map and helped us with any questions we had. I would stay there again if visiting Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: raegaz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Lleo hotel for 3 nights, the hotel reception staff are very helpful, hotel clean and in a great location by the ramblers and a short walk from the sea. The hotel has a small pool on the roof open until 8pm every evening, perfect for cooling down after a day of sight seeing!

Reviews.Title: “We recommend Lleo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichieW974
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lleo is in a great location. It's just a block from the Ramblas and is a very short walk from the bus stop for the airport bus. The staff spoke English and were very helpful. Our room was clean and there was a free computer in the lobby. The neighborhood is safe and vibrant. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “learn from my mistake”
Reviews.Author: ginnywrites
Reviews.Content: This hotel requires full prepayment and I made the horrific emistake of actually doing so several months in advance. Three weeks before we were due to depart, health crises (more than one) forced us to cancel. Yes--the fine print said 'no refunds' but even the Airlines (!) give you slack when there's a medical emergency. The entire Spain itinerary has been a nightmare to unravel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Scrubbers
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was an excellent room for what we paid for (70euro per night) as it was very spacious, clean and comfortable. The hotel is in an excellent location as it is situated just a few minutes walk from Placa Catalunya where you'll find airport buses & Catalunya metro station. It is also just off La Ramblas, which can be quite busy and noisy at night. We actually booked two double rooms last minute through bookings.com which offered a 50% saving. We travelled with our friends who were on their honeymoon so we requested at least one nice room for the newly married couple. Even to our friends surprise, the staff managed to organise a really nice room on the top floor (#602) but when we got there we were also surprised that the staff had also booked us on the same floor but in room 601 instead. So you could rate the service as excellent even before stepping into our rooms! The top floor only contained three rooms as the roof-top pool occupies the other space. The only small gripes we had for room 601 was that we did ask for a double but they stuck two king singles together instead. However, both single beds were electrically adjustable, like beds you would find in a hospital!!! The mattress as a result was a bit soft for our liking but that was the only issue we had. The rest of the room contained a large LG flatscreen TV and plenty of wardrobe space. There was also a balcony but you couldn't see much as the hotel sign was right in front blocking any views, but this wasn't a problem as we were staying during winter anyway and wouldn't utilise it. The bathroom was huge!!! Two basins, a bathtub with spa jets and a large double shower with massaging jets for your body & legs!!! The only thing missing was some decent shower and bath products. I would definitely recommend others to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “okay, not great”
Reviews.Author: pj1290
Reviews.Content: Hotel was okay, not great. Overpriced. Very noisy if you sleep in a room on the street. Stay away from room 105, there is a pipe that sends off a ghastly smell when it rains. The maid told us that the staff know about it, but nothing is done. We stayed in this room one night and the stench was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: angemorange
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Lleo for 3 nights in January 2010 with my partner and young son. We booked a triple room and had lots of space. The room was clean and comfortable and had a small fridge. Location wise the hotel is in a great place - just minutes from La Ramblas and Place de Catalunya and the staff were very helpful and welcoming. Breakfast was included and we managed to find something each morning, usually toast, croissants and cereal. We would go back again, although watching out for the endless pickpockets and con merchants around Barcelona was a bit tiresome, even out of season! If you have small children go to the aquarium - it was great fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, expected more”
Reviews.Author: buckeye1995
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location for what we needed but it is not what I expected. I heard about it from someone that stays there eveytime they visit Barcelona. It was average but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Great location, comfortable and clean rooms, and kind and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JaimeElba
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a very enjoyable visit in Barcelona (22-27 January 2010). Our stay at the Lleo Hotel contributed enormously to the wonderful feeling of visiting this beautiful city. Great location: 2 blocks from Plaza de Catalunya and Las Ramblas, which is the last stop of the Aerobus (which connects from and to the airport for only 5 Euros) and the start of the Barcelona Turistic bus, and one block from the Universitat Metro station (which connects you with all the attractions of Barcelona). Kind and very helpful staff: upon early arrival our luggage was stored until our room was ready (at about noon). The staff at the Reception gave us basic information on sites and how to reach them (including maps). Mr. Agustin was extremely kind all along our stay. Muchas gracias, Agustin! Rooms: clean and comfortable. Our first room was on the first floor and had a small patio. Unfortunately, a noisy group arrived to the hotel (noice insulation is not optimal) and we did not sleep well during the second night. Agustin transferred us to a beautiful room on the sixt floor for the following 3 nights, which enabled us to sleep comfortably. Breakfast: excellent! Staff: kind and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money and a gret location”
Reviews.Author: EoghanJ
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend break in Barcelona with our 9 year old son, and we had a great time. The Hotel is located just off Catalunya Square, and 2 minutes from La Rambla, so excellent location. We were on the 5th floor, and it was very quiet, even though we were so central, and there was a festival that weekend. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Room very clean, and with electric beds that can be adjusted for reading. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SierradelRio
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lleo in Barcelona, exceeded our expectations. The service in Front Desk was great. We arrived early in the morning 10am to the hotel - check -in time 3pm- and they care to make us as comfortable as they can until our room was available. The rooms were very clean and very comfortable. The location of the hotel at just 2 blocks from La Rambla and Plaza Cataluna and Main stop for Bus Turistico (hip-hop bus) complete the package for an excellent stay in Barcelona. I strongly recommend this hotel. Booking.com is a great place to look for great rates. Just keep looking every day, rates changes quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lancsbabe
Reviews.Content: Good Location, Nice room with spa bath and electric beds, lovely and clean, staff were very helpfull, the only downside was they dont have an iron to lend you or a kettle for your room. I have been to barcelona a few times and would stay in this hotel again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Central for everything”
Reviews.Author: rubyduoEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: . Hotel is ideally situated very near to Placa de Catalunya and La Rambla. There are two Metro stations close by and also city tour buses and airport buses run from the Catalunya Square so we found it very easy to get around via public transport and on foot. Hotel was very clean and room was comfortable and though we faced the street suprisingly quiet. Good choice at breakfast though hot food not great. Staff generally friendly and helpful. Only negative comment really was charge for use of room safe at 2 euros 50 a day which at first we thought was a returnable deposit.

Reviews.Title: “Central and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Phreddo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lleo is only a short walk from La Rambla and its street entertainment and shopping. Even closer is the Metro station making access to other parts of the city very convenient. The staff were very friendly and breakfast had a great variety of offerings. Wireless Internet was free and easy to access but sometimes slowed by heavy load.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but too noisy.”
Reviews.Author: purpleelefont
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and clean, however very noisy at night from other guest. The rooms average with hard beds and pillows (only one pillow each!!!). Location of hotel good as only a short walk from main attractions. Breakfast ok as far as breakfast goes. Staff very polite. The hotel charge to recieve faxes. The bar prices were very dear.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of Movida!”
Reviews.Author: beautifulanddoomed
Reviews.Content: We went on a trip to Barcelona in March and we booked 2 rooms in Hotel LLeo: definitely worth it! It is located in the Rambla, close to Placa Catalunya and thus really convenient also for public transportation. The hotel is clean, provides wi-fi internet and has also a swimming pool and a small meeting room; the rooms are quite big and comfortable and the staff helpful and friendly. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: lovetotraveleurope_9
Reviews.Content: Only a few blocks from Catalunya Plaza and top of La Ramblas. Very nice lobby. Room had extra sitting room and even a small private patio on ground floor. quiet except for plumbing sounds. Buffet breakfast very extensive. Staff polite but not friendly. Refused to print out a boarding pass for us even though they have free wi-fi in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional & Rude”
Reviews.Author: tiger6780
Reviews.Content: While I did not end up staying at this hotel, I am giving it a bad review because of the pathetic service (actually lack of service) I received from them. I contacted this hotel via email to make a booking and they requested I email or fax my credit card details - soemthing that is not only extremely unsafe in this day and age of identity theft, but totally un-necessary, when I could easily call and give them my credit card details, as I have done in the past with many hotels in Spain. When I refused to fax or email my credit card I received a rude email from the hotel saying "sorry but we have to cancel the booking" - hello, why on earth do they need my credit card details in writing? Every other hotel accepts this so why wouldn't they? I am glad I never got to stay there actually, at least I know the staff at the hotel Husa Oriente where I booked instead, the staff there are nowhere near as rude as the staff at Hotel Lleo.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ladygiggles
Reviews.Content: Hotel was 5 mins away from the famous las rambles street! hotel was clean and kept to a high standard. Rooms were clean and tidy. queen size beds, large bathroom, balcony overlooking the square. Staff were very friendly. swimming pool is lovely. It is noisey at night but that adds to the experience of being so close to the square. Only down side is they don't provide tea/coffee or water in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laces08
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, especially the central location (literally round the corner from La Rambla). The hotel was also clean and comfortable, with a nicer decor than most 3* hotels I have stayed in. The reception staff were helpful, offering to phone taxis etc. The rooms were clean and spacious, the only drawback was that the view wasn't exactly scenic (building site), but as we were out all day sightseeing this didn't really matter. There is an outdoor pool on the roof of the hotel, and although small, is a great way to cool down in the summer. There are also sun loungers on the roof, and the view is great.

Reviews.Title: “would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: LancsNic
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location for sightseeing.La Rambla 5 mins away ,the gothic area close by.The port is only a 20 mins stroll and the beach25 mins.We booked a superior double room on a low level as i dont go in lifts but on arrival were told our room was on the top (6th) floor .However after seeing the room we couldnt give it up and walked the stairs! our room was spacious, modern,with large decked outdoor terrace,huge bathroom with jaccuzi bath,it was at the rear of hotel and was a bit noisy late on but we were so shattered with sightseeing etc etc it didnt keep us awake at all.The buffet breakfast had everything you could want, though we found it a bit airless and stuffy in the dinning room.all staff helpfull and friendly,hotel clean and tidyGood value for the money.We had a fab stay and would go back to same hotel again ,it could have done with tea and coffee in the rooms though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: sopranos1969
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lleo for 3 nights. We enjoyed the very Central location, and foundit very easy to travel to all the sights by metro either from Plaza Catalunya or Universitat Metro stations. We ate by the Plaza Espagna the first night as we went to see the Magic Fountains of Montjuic. However, far more enjoyed the Hard Rock Cafe in Plaza Catalunya, which is a very short walk from our hotel. La Rambla is only a few minutes walk away also. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. They also allowed us to check in 2 hours early due to our early morning flight from Manchester

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TeamTurners
Reviews.Content: Great location,right at the top of the La Ramba between two Metro stations.Very friendly staff,Room well we were only there for a weekend and it was a bit small but big enough. bathroom was clean and of a very high standard. the bedroom was at the back of the hotel so was not noisey other that the police sirens!!! Breakfast was OK typical Spainish, but no fresh fruit, and tea came from a machine. COULD DO WITH, Tea/Coffee faciltties in the room. Larger Towels, at least some english news on the lovley little flat screen telly. I will be returning to Barcelona and would deffently consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Schade64
Reviews.Content: Our flight arrived early in the morning and the Hotel helped us out, but holding our luggage, giving directions, treating us as their guest. The room was very nice, though a little crowded with the four of us in it. It was much nicer than we expected and we were made to feel as family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: retiredandtraveling
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here before a cruise and everything went very well. The hotel is a short walk from Pl de Catalyuna where the Aerobus from the airport drops you off. Room was a little small, but clean, quiet and had everything we needed. Hotel is a 6 minute walk from La Rambla (take the interesting alley near the hotel). Best price was obtained by e-mail directly with hotel reservation desk - 97 Euros including breakfast. Breakfast buffet was very good - hot and cold items, as well as 3 choices of wine!! Lobby is lovely and Alicia at the front desk was very helpful and kind. Barcelona is a lovely city and well worth a visit by all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: nanasnest
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lleo for 2 nights pre-cruise earlier this month. We took a taxi to the hotel and were allowed to check in early which was really nice. The room was fine - we were at the front of the hotel overlooking the main street which I was concerned would be noisy at night but we slept like logs. It was midweek so it may be noisier on weekends. We were also happy with the breakfast in the morning. There is a large lounge on the main floor with a computer with free internet access which I didn't realize at first. I think the Lleo offered good value because Barcelona is so expensive and a lot of hotels do not include breakfast. It was so easy to walk to Las Ramblas and the Gothic Quarter from here and there is a subway stop right across from the hotel. Metro is easy to use. We also took the Hop on, Hop off bus which leaves from Placa Catalyuna nearby. One mistake I made was to ask the front desk to call a taxi to go to the ship. It would have been less expensive to flag one down from the hotel. I should know that by now!

Reviews.Title: “unexpected extra guest!”
Reviews.Author: DeeDee1710
Reviews.Content: Hotel location couldn't have been better. Very central to Place de Catalunya. Twin room was small and basic but satisfactory for the needs of my friend and I on a 5 night city break (we were out all day, in briefly to shower & change before going out again in the evening). Whilst nothing could have been described as luxurious, bathroom had all necessary facilities. Room and bathroom appeared clean, with daily maid service. Breakfast buffet included self-service breakfasting requirements - cereal, toast, croissants, tea/coffee, orange juice, cold meat, cheese, bacon, sausage etc. On our last night we returned about 9.00pm to leave some shopping before going out again. As my friend opened the door she announced that "something" had run across the floor. On investigating, the "something" turned out to be a MOUSE! On reporting this immediately to reception, this was dealt with by the maid very efficiently. If it hadn't been for this incident, I would probably have visited this hotel again in the future for a short city break. However, as a result of our unexpected little guest, next time I will be trying another hotel!.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: JudeYuill
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel and flights with British Airways got a great deal. Hotel is only 5 mins walk from the top of the Ramblas - also therefore only 5 mins from Catalunya Square where you can get the metro or Bus Turistic. 2 routes available at this time of year - 26 Euros for a two day pass hop on hop off. We got into one of our two rooms prior to check in time and dumped all our luggage. The rooms were standard, clean, not very exciting - but we'd come to see Barcelona not the hotel room! We had front facing rooms which was lovely - noisey street but did not disturb sleep - noisey guests did (so take ear plugs!). Breakfast was in a very bright and cheery room - again typical breakfast, although did have English fry too! Temperature reached 76 degrees over the weekend and we LOVED the pool area at the top of the hotel. Pool is only a metre deep - but to just enjoy the blue skies, hot sun and cool water before we checked out (late check out 12noon). Hotel looked after our luggae until we returned to get a taxi. Taxi from airport including surcharges for luggage/passengers was less than 30 Euros. We just went out in the street to get a return taxi for similar amount. In general Taxis very cheap. Would recommend taxi hopping too, found these very cheap. Highlights, Sagradia Familiar (queue for the lift - if you have time!!), Port Vell, Palace and Sat night fountain display with music (8pm start I think). So much, great place.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: laurimart
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel Lleo can not be beat! Just a few blocks off Las Ramblas, close to the Plaza Catalunya (where the fantastic tour buses stop). There are restaurants, shops, an ATM, everything you need within easy walking distance. The hotel is clean, the staff is friendly and speaks English. There is a breakfast buffet included, and that is nice. Food wasn't wonderful, but it did the trick. Our triple room was crowded with three twin beds, but that is to be expected in Europe. The rooms are small but adequate, and very clean. Walls are thin, so it is a bit noisy with hall noise and room noise. If you are sensitive to that, it might be a problem. The computer and free internet were a bonus. We had absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda B
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel. Excellent location, very clean. Friendly helpful staff. Great beds. 8 of us arrived early at 11.30am and we were given 3 of our 4 double rooms. Good safe deposit boxes in the rooms. Breakfast was superb. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: annabanana82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Lleo during the last weekend in August for 3 nights. The best thing about the hotel is it's fantastic location right in the city centre - just off Las Ramblas, the main shopping area which leads down to the port. It cost 30 Euros to get to the hotel from Barcelona Airport. The rooms are quite basic, but quite spacious and comfortable. Our room was right at the front of the hotel, yet there was not much noise from the street outside. The rooms are well air-conditioned which is good as it was still quite hot at the end of August. The rooms had a TV and fridge as well as a good sized bathroom with 2 sinks, WC, bath & shower. There is a pool on the roof of the hotel which is open daily - although check during the winter. This is a nice touch - especially being so hot during the Summer. The breakfast was more than I was expecting! They had a good range of cereals, pastries, breads, toast etc as well as meats / cheese and all the ingredients that make up a cooked breakfast with a choice of eggs. It's a buffet style, so stock up and you won't need much lunch! The reception staff were very helpful, speaking a few different languages. When it was time to leave, they called us a taxi which arrived in record time! All in all, a great weekend in a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevin-Sue
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel because of its position so close to Las Ramblas and a central point to explore the city and head a great time there. We thoroughly recommend it. The hotel is very clean and inviting, the staff very friendly and helpful. The bedrooms are well decorated and pleasant. The beds are very comfortable and even have electric tilt. The table the buffet breakfast was spread on is a remarkable cantilever and to be see to be believed. The food was good and fresh if a little unimaginative. The free wi-fi allowed us to keep in touch with home. The only think that let it down was the noise from the main road outside. But hey, you book a hotel in the middle of the city and what do you expect – peace and quite? You’re not in the room much anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at budget cost”
Reviews.Author: KMP_8
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at hotel Lleo with a group of 8 girls on a hen weekend and we couldn't have asked for a better hotel - the rooms were all above expectations and we all came away saying that we would definitely stay there again. It is well situated for Las Ramblas and Port Vell and is only a 10 Euro taxi ride away from Port Olympus (where there was slightly more night life.) Reception ordered the cabs for us as well so the trip was very easy. The hotel is also in an excellent location for getting the tour buses which start only about a five minute walk away. I would recommend the red route for seeing the Nou camp and cathedral. Overall this hotel is one that I would recommend to anyone going to Barcelona on a modest budget.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault the hotel lleo!”
Reviews.Author: citybreak01
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a brilliant weekend in Barcelona staying at the Hotel LLEO, the hotel is in a perfect location, very close to the Ramblers and about a 30 minute stroll down to Port Vell, we had a quiet room at the back of the hotel which had the luxury of a double bed and the bath even had jacuzi jets!! Maid service came into our room everyday to clean, make the beds and change the towels, the hotel is extremely clean throughout. The breakfast was buffet style with everything you could possibly want on offer, needless to say we wouldn't hesitate to book this hotel again as we feel sure we will be returning to Barcelona in the future :0) A resturant we would highly recommend is called "Hispano" and it's alongside Port Vell, we had Catalunian paella there which is made with noodles instead of rice....absolutely delicious! :0) If you stay at this hotel we feel sure you would not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Blaire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at Hotel Lleo 13 - 17 April 2008. We, myself husband and 9 year old daughter, booked this hotel direct via their website at a significant saving than going through a travel agent. We paid 160.00 Euros per night for bed and breakfast including taxes. The hotel is lovely - we had a large clean triple room with electric beds, air conditioning, piped music overlooking the street with a small balcony. With the balcony doors open it was noisy but to be expected for a city centre hotel - its surprising how much noise the doors cut out! The bathroom was fully functional if a little dated. Breakfast was excellent - definately something for everyone - buffet style which was constantly topped up - cooked food as well as contential meats and cheeses - we really enjoyed it. The location is excellent - just off Catalunya Square and La Ramblas - within easy walking distance of the beach and the hoards of restaurents and shops. The staff were efficient and polite - allowing us to leave our luggage before the room was ready and after departure. We booked the hotel, flights etc all seperately but, fortunately it all worked out well - take the Aeorbus from the airport to the Square at a cost of 4.05 Euros leaves every 10 mins or so and takes approx. 25 mins. We used the tourist bus which was excellent and covered all the major sights - you can 'hop on and off'. Public toilets are non-existant - a slight problem with children - but theres always McDonalds, Starbucks for these conveniences. All in all, we would definately stay here again - I just regret not staying longer - Barcelona is a fab city with fantastic buildings and lots to see and do - its great to have a beach to relax on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lynne50
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in this hotel - great location just off Place Catalunya at the top of La Ramblas. Rooms clean,bathrooms a little dated but great shower in bath quite powerful and plenty of hot water at all times. Air conditioning didn't work but didn't need it, electric beds quite a novelty. Clean towels every day. Reception staff were a little abrupt but had no problems with them. Only booked room so didn't try restaurant had drink in bar first night found it expensive so didn't use it again. For breakfast had coffee in Starbucks just up the street. Small swimming pool on roof looked nice but not warm enough when we were there to try it. Would use this hotel again. Took other reviewers advice taking bus from airport 4.05 Euros go to last stop Place Catalunya - people very helpful when we were asking which way to hotel. Found Bus Turistic really good value bought 2 day pass did red and blue routes first day then used bus again to specific attractions on second day. Found lovely restaurant in square just off La Ramblas Les Quinz Nitz (Not very sure of spelling) Be prepared to queue but well worth the wait good food at very resonable prices. We got there about 9:30pm had to wait about 45 mins. Another restaurant in same square not very good at all - staff just interested in serving you and getting you out - dreadful steak mediocre paella. Not too sure of name but I think it is something Mundos.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel - Wouldnt return”
Reviews.Author: Truutraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a long weekend at the end of March. If its location your looking for you cant go wrong with this hotel, only 40 mins by bus number 1 from barcelona ariport, straight to Plaze de catelunga, from there 5 min walk to hotel. Besdies that hotel looks nice initally but rooms are run down, air con is tempermental, either to hot or to cold as said by other reviewers. Bar is very expensive £9 a drink and shuts at 11. Breakfast also 25 euros for 2 people, but nothing to warrant that kind of money. Got to the hotel to be told no double rooms so would have to have twin even though paid for double. Changed next day but wasted time on short trip faffing about. Staff are mostly nice. Personally would pay a little extra for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gemzii89
Reviews.Content: Ive just got back from Barcelona with my boyfriend, after a 2 night break. I have to say our hotel was great value for money! As you walked into the hotel, it has a lovely, clean reception. The receptionists are nice and friendly and try really hard to speak English the best they can. We were given our room card, and made our way up, via the lifts which were nice and quick. As we entered the room, I was really shocked to find how nice the room was. It was really clean and tidy, and a great size. We had two single beds pushed together, but that didn't matter too much to us. We had a mini fridge, television, (however the only English programmes were Eurosport and CNN) but your not in Barcelona to watch telly anyway! Our balcony was nice, as our room was at the front of the hotel too. The bathroom was nice and clean too, with a power shower. The maids cleaned our rooms and gave us new towels everyday after midday. The breakfast buffet was nice for meeting our needs aswell, from chicken nuggets and chips to ham and cheese. So plenty of variety to choose from. The position of the hotel was nice too, only a 2 minute walk from the famous Las Ramblas where they had market stalls, with jewellery and plants. Even animal stalls, where you can buy animal cages, and animals! We took an 'aeroport' bus into the centre of Barcelona this only cost 3.95 euros per person. Which compares a lot to the taxi charges of around 30 euros. Whilst we were there we enjoyed the tourist sightseeing bus. On two separate trips, they can take you round the northern and southern side of the city. For just 23 euros per person. The buses run every 8-15 minutes from the top of the Las Ramblas and you can also hop on and off whenever you like. They are guided tours aswell, receiving some earphones. Shopping in Barcelona is great too. Plenty of shops in all different areas. Eating in Barcelona is relatively cheap. However on Sundays, most restaurants are closed. The only problem I found with Barcelona was generally most places I went, wasn't very wheel-chair friendly. Some places didn't have lifts, only elevators and stairs. However I would definitely go to Barcelona again, as I have found it to be a great city and I would recommend anyone to go!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value At Lleo”
Reviews.Author: Garyt00
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Lleo Hotel Barcelona for two nights - 8th and 9th January 2008. We decided to have a short break after the Christmas festivities and have some retail therapy in the excellent Barcelona sales. We found the Lleo to be very handy; right next to the Ramblas and Place de Catalunya. Near all the shops and restaurants. The reception staff were very helpful and when we asked for a smoking room allocated a twin with electric beds, jacuzzi bath and flat screen TV -room 516 (for all smokers who wish a bit of 3 star luxury). Although the hotel seemed not very busy (probably the time of year) the continental buffet breakfast was extensive, fresh kept well stocked and had everything you could have wished for. The public rooms are pleasant, modern bright and airy. The hotel was very clean. The amount of bleach used in the toilets could make you pass out from the fumes. A well kept 3 star hotel with pleasant staff in an excellent location at a fair price. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed by the Hotel Lleo”
Reviews.Author: Milleens
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in the Hotel Lleo in July and we were very impressed. The hotel is very centrally located, it's only 2 minutes away from the Placa de Catalunya from where you can jump on all the different Metro lines or alternatively at the other end of the street there is another smaller metro stop. It's really close to Las Ramblas and on a very well-lit street so there's no worries about walking around there at night. The room was bigger than I had expected so we were pleasantly surprised and the bathroom was lovely as well. We got fresh towels everyday. The air conditioning was a little bit cold for us but we were melting if we switched it off so one of us (ie. my sister) would have to get up a couple of times to switch it on and off. I would definitely return there (although maybe with warmer pyjamas) and I would definitely recommend it. The only fault that I can find is that the breakfast there is quite expensive and, for what we got, it wasn't worth it. Still, there are plenty of cafes waiting to be discovered so I wouldn't let a small thing like that turn me off!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavemScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night 7th November. Excellent location. Very good standard for 2 star hotel. Everything clean and tidy. If seeking a low-cost weekend away, I would go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SUNWORISHPER
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, the location is brillant just turn right when you come out of the hotel and las ramblas is at the bottom of the street the metro station is also at the end of this street. The hotel is very clean and the reception staff are vey helpful. The only downside was the location of our room it was beside the lift which meant we didnt have a view when we opned the curtains and the window it opened onto a long shoot with a skylight there was no light at all from this. We didnt spend much time in our room so it didnt really annoy us but as we were paying the same as everyone else a bit of light would have been nice. Although the room was beside the lift the noise of it wasnt a problem there is so much to see in Barcelona that by the end of the day we were wrecked and slept soundly. The food in the hotel was ok we ate pizza and bolognese and it was average, breakfast has a good deal of variety and tasted good

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, and Perfectly Quiet”
Reviews.Author: SteveInMinn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from four days in Barcelona (and three days and Madrid), and can wholeheartedly recommend the Hotel Lleo. When booking on the hotel website, we asked for a nonsmoking inside (not facing the street) room, and we were accommodated. The room was extremely quiet -- quite a feat given how noisy the Ramblas area can be. The bed was comfy and the all-marble bathroom pretty big. Others have said how perfect the location is, and they are 100 percent right. You cannot beat this location. A couple other things: The Internet access in the lobby is free. There's a little swimming pool on the sun deck upstairs that we didn't use but that was a nice touch. We did not try the breakfast, so I can't comment on the food. All in all, an excellent stay. We'd book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Rooms need some updating/ Bring earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: Christine W
Reviews.Content: Went to Barcelona for the weekend with my 20 year old daughter. We loved the location of Hotel Lleo --just a couple of easy walking blocks from Las Ramblas (lots of shopping) and Plaça de Catalunya (where you can pick up buses for tourist routes). If you really need some American food 'fix' then between the hotel and Cataluyna there is a Burger King, Mcdonalds, Starbucks, Subway and a Hard Rock Cafe. There is also an ATM right next door and a video arcade a few doors down (my 17 year old son would have loved it!) When you walk into the lobby of the hotel it is bright and looks new, so we were a little disappointed to find the rooms a bit tired and in need of updating. We had a room facing the street so it was definitely noisy until very late....I would suggest ear plugs if you want to get to sleep before 2 am (on a weekend night). We were also surprised that our room would not be cleaned until 3ish in the afternoon -- not a real problem, but a bit surprising. There is free internet access in the lounge area behind the elevators. We did not eat at the hotel. We took the Bus Turistic to get an overview of the city and found their ticketing / boarding process a bit disorganized. They had a bus parked in front of the Hard Rock Cafe where we waited in quite a long line only to find out this was simply to buy tickets (22 euro for 2 days). We then had to go down the street to pick up the bus (located in front of El Corte Ingles -- a HUGE department store and groceries too). Here we also waited in a very long line because most people want to sit on the top of the double decker bus so it takes quite some time for the line to move along. WE also found that you could buy tickets from this line as well (so our previous wait in front of Hard Rock cafe was a waste of time). ON our second day we got to El Corte Ingles about 9:15 and found many less people....so I would definitely suggest getting an early start to avoid the longer lines that pick up later in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: GrangemouthBeamer
Reviews.Content: Cracking location at top end of Las Ramblas, 2 minutes walk from the square. Hotel is very clean, staff friendly and plenty of food for buffet breakfast. Bedrooms a little small but we were lucky enough to have electic adjusting beds (brilliant), Decor in rooms was a little bit aged but room service did an excellant job. Only problem was the ridiculous amount of noise from a large group of American female students who showed no respect to other hotel users, coming in drunk and singing at all hours of the night (seemingly they found it amusing waking up other guests at two in the morning dancing in the corridors). Brilliant Italian restuarant 5 mins walk away called La Mafia (discount card at reception) great food, decor, music and not to heavy on the pocket. Watch out for new scam at nite, ' tourist' approaches you asking for directions and within seconds you have two plain clothes police (haha) surrounding you asking if you are buying drugs or exchanging counterfit money. Luckily my wife speaks a little Spanish and we soon sussed them out. Never show your passport or wallet as they grab it on scarper into the distance. All in all, an above average 3 * hotel, would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but take earplugs with you!!!”
Reviews.Author: Highlandboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a six night break here. Firstly, great location - a gentle five minute stroll to Las Ramblas. Lots of great places to eat - we particularly recommend the tapas place just round the corner (turn left at hotel exit!)!!. The hotel itself boasts free internet access, air-conditioned rooms, beds which are fully remotey adjustable (never had this before in any hotel room!!) The rooms are a bit pokey, but very clean and you're not going to spend a lot of time in your room anyway. It was great coming back for a little siesta in the afternoon having left your air con on since morning!!!!! The only downside is the noise - not so much the traffic, although our room was at the back, but other guests. The walls must be paper thin. You could just about hear a conversation through the wall without even trying! Take earplugs and problems are solved however. All staff were very helpful and our cleaning lady was always smiling. The Aerobus to/from the airport stops five minutes walk away - very handy also!! Another slight critisism would be that room televisions have no English language channels. We would return here however despite the noise problem

Reviews.Title: “Not that good...”
Reviews.Author: lansonlady
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location but that is about it. Our family occupied two rooms. One was on the front of the building, room 412 and whilst we could live wirth the noise from the street we found the smell from the bathroom very bad. When we filled the bath and bidet with water the smell did subside. Our second room, room 414 had one window fitted with opaque glass. When we opened the window it looked into three other walls which formed a 6ft x 6ft quadrangle which extended from the ground floor to the top floor. The non smoking bar/lounge area in the hotel closed at 11pm and if you want to sit and have a drink and plan the next day you have to sit in a small 'smoking lounge' - ok if you are smokers but we aren't. The breakast looks good - but food which should be hot is not, the pastries are greasy and the biscuits stale. The rooms are in need of redecorating and a updating. There was inground dirt in most corners in the bedrooms and bathrooms and the whole of the hotel has the feel of 'needs attention'. The staff on reception were friendly and helpful. The staff on the bar less so. We were there for a short stay after completing a med cruise. We didn't let the standard of the hotel spoil our stay in Barcelona which is a truely fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “fab location”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireDebbie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 2nd -6th August.We had a fantastic time! Our group consisted of 8 people -4 rooms.All of our rooms were clean and comfortable. 3 rooms were on the road side and the double glazing cut out alot of the noise.Yes sometimes you could hear a siren but hey you are in the city!! We actually enjoyed sitting on the small balcony and watching the hussle and bustle! The pool on the roof terrace is small but it has jets and seats at the side which is relaxing after a day in the city.You can see alot from the roof terrace. The location of the hotel couldn't be any better. Just off La Ramba and catalonia square. Very safe to walk about at night just avoid the street cleaners at midnight washing down the paths! A gt tapas bar is celler de tapa.ask at reception for a voucher as you can get a free glass of wine. A must to do is the turistic bus - hop on hop off. two day pass is approx 22 euros.gt way to see the city.red and blue routes.We spent a day at the beach on the blue route. this can be caught just around the corner from the hotel. Reception at the hotel are really friendly and helpful. NOTE - all bars close at 11pm on sundays even the hotel bar. We did the barcelona footy stadium (on the red route) very poor but worth a visit - in your ticket price for the bus you get discount vouchers so remember to use them! Another must is the castle reached by cable car(on the blue route) approx 7 euros for cable car. fantastic views from there. we also did the art museum again fab views from outside. The olympic stadium is worth a visit too -free! you can walk to this from the art museum. *** Last point to make is beware of thiefs- one of our party had a bag pinched from beneath our noses in an ice cream palour on the last day so had his passport in -luckily easy jet let him board! take a photocopy of your passport as you never know.After checking out on your last day ask to put passports in hotel safe!! During your visit the safe in your room costs 10 euros deposit and 2.50 euros per day. *** Well i hope this is helpful. We all had a gt trip and would reccoment this hotel highly. by the way the police station is under the square!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevense91
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel with my 17 year old daughter and would recommend it to anyone. It is spotless, has friendly staff, brilliant breakfasts, helpful receptionists, rooms cleaned every day and very central to all attractions. One big bonus is the swimming pool on the 6th floor (roof top) not only has it terrific views from the roof but the pool and sun bathing area is again spotless and very fresh. Two minutes walk from busy centre and shops. My daughter would also recommend it to friends her age and we would both return to this Hotel again and again, year after year.

Reviews.Title: “Fab!”
Reviews.Author: Lozzie1989
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from an 8 day stay at the Hotel Lleo with my boyfriend (we are aged 18 and 22). I thought that the hotel was great and the staff were friendly! It was so lovely and we were very upset to leave. Barcelona, especially Las Ramblas, is very hot so it was lovely to go back to an air conditioned room. We stayed on the 2nd floor, and although for the first couple of days we thought that the walls were quite thin, we soon got used to it. We stayed room only but did have the buffet breakfast one morning. This cost 10 euroes and was good, but maybe not 10 euro good. Breakfast included toast, cereal, fruit, bacon, eggs, pastries, etc. The pool is on the roof but unfortunately was closed for the first 5 days of our holiday, however this didn't really matter as we decided to see the sights these days instead. The pool is quite small but lovely, as is the deck but there are few sunbeds. There were some great restuarants on Las Ramblas, one that stood out to us (we went 3 times) was called Attic - we both would definitely recommend it here! We paid £512 for room only staying 8 nights, which we thought was pretty good value! (We booked on travelrepublic.co.uk). If we ever go to Barcelona again, I am sure we would definitely consider staying here!

Reviews.Title: “hotel lleo”
Reviews.Author: towidge
Reviews.Content: excellent central location, very clean, comfortable hotel with helpful staff. Great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position, Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: 40_and_counting
Reviews.Content: Our room was not brilliant - next to the lift, which was not a problem in itself, but smaller because of this, and with a window that looked out onto a concrete wall! If your room number ends in '01', you will have one of these rooms! Decorated the same as all the others, though, and spotlessly clean. Bathroom big enough with all you needed and fresh towels everyday. Even a small fridge for you to use. Breakfast ok - plenty there - but only the British truly know how to cook bacon and sausage!
